member.summary: Configuration options for the Azure Storage storage provider.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.Options.AzureStorageOptions.ControlQueueBatchSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of messages to pull from the control queue at a time.
member.remarks: Messages pulled from the control queue are buffered in memory until the internal dispatcher is ready to process them.
member.value: A positive integer configured by the host. The default value is 32.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.Options.AzureStorageOptions.PartitionCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the partition count for the control queue.
member.remarks: Increasing the number of partitions will increase the number of workers that can concurrently execute orchestrator functions. However, increasing the partition count can also increase the amount of load placed on the storage account and on the thread pool if the number of workers is smaller than the number of partitions.
member.value: A positive integer between 1 and 16. The default value is 4.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.Options.AzureStorageOptions.ControlQueueVisibilityTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility timeout of dequeued control queue messages.
member.value: A TimeSpan configured by the host. The default is 5 minutes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.Options.AzureStorageOptions.WorkItemQueueVisibilityTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility timeout of dequeued work item queue messages.
member.value: A TimeSpan configured by the host. The default is 5 minutes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.Options.AzureStorageOptions.TrackingStoreConnectionStringName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the Azure Storage connection string to use for the durable tracking store (History and Instances tables).

remarks.para: If not specified, the connection string is used for the durable tracking store.

This property is primarily useful when deploying multiple apps that need to share the same tracking infrastructure. For example, when deploying two versions of an app side by side, using the same tracking store allows both versions to save history into the same table, which allows clients to query for instance status across all versions.

member.value: The name of a connection string that exists in the app's application settings.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.Options.AzureStorageOptions.TrackingStoreNamePrefix
member.summary: Gets or sets the name prefix to use for history and instance tables in Azure Storage.
member.remarks: This property is only used when is specified. If no prefix is specified, the default prefix value is "DurableTask".
member.value: The prefix to use when naming the generated Azure tables.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.Options.AzureStorageOptions.MaxQueuePollingInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum queue polling interval.
member.value: Maximum interval for polling control and work-item queues.

member.summary: Configuration of the trace options for the Durable Task Extension.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.Options.TraceOptions.TraceInputsAndOutputs
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to trace the inputs and outputs of function calls.
member.remarks: The default behavior when tracing function execution events is to include the number of bytes in the serialized inputs and outputs for function calls. This provides minimal information about what the inputs and outputs look like without bloating the logs or inadvertently exposing sensitive information to the logs. Setting to true will instead cause the default function logging to log the entire contents of function inputs and outputs.
member.value: true to trace the raw values of inputs and outputs; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.Options.TraceOptions.TraceReplayEvents
member.summary: Gets or sets if logs for replay events need to be recorded.
member.remarks: The default value is false, which disables the logging of replay events.
member.value: Boolean value specifying if the replay events should be logged.

member.summary: Configuration options for the Durable Task extension.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.HubName
member.summary: Gets or sets default task hub name to be used by all , , and instances.
member.remarks: A task hub is a logical grouping of storage resources. Alternate task hub names can be used to isolate multiple Durable Functions applications from each other, even if they are using the same storage backend.
member.value: The name of the default task hub.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.StorageProvider

member.summary: The section of configuration related to notifications.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.MaxConcurrentActivityFunctions
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of activity functions that can be processed concurrently on a single host instance.
member.remarks: Increasing activity function concurrent can result in increased throughput but can also increase the total CPU and memory usage on a single worker instance.
member.value: A positive integer configured by the host. The default value is 10X the number of processors on the current machine.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.MaxConcurrentOrchestratorFunctions
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of orchestrator functions that can be processed concurrently on a single host instance.
member.value: A positive integer configured by the host. The default value is 10X the number of processors on the current machine.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.NotificationUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets the base URL for the HTTP APIs managed by this extension.
member.remarks: This property is intended for use only by runtime hosts.
member.value: A URL pointing to the hosted function app that responds to status polling requests.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.ExtendedSessionsEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether to enable extended sessions.

remarks.para: Extended sessions can improve the performance of orchestrator functions by allowing them to skip replays when new messages are received within short periods of time.

Note that orchestrator functions which are extended this way will continue to count against the limit. To avoid starvation, only half of the maximum number of allowed concurrent orchestrator functions can be concurrently extended at any given time. The property can also be used to control how long an idle orchestrator function is allowed to be extended.
It is recommended that this property be set to false during development to help ensure that the orchestrator code correctly obeys the idempotency rules.

member.value: true to enable extended sessions; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.ExtendedSessionIdleTimeoutInSeconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time in seconds before an idle session times out. The default value is 30 seconds.
member.remarks: This setting is applicable when is set to true.
member.value: The number of seconds before an idle session times out.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.CustomLifeCycleNotificationHelperType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type name of a custom to use for handling lifecycle notification events.
member.value: Assembly qualified class name that implements ILifeCycleNotificationHelper.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.Extensions.DurableTask.DurableTaskOptions.GetConnectionStringName
member.summary: A helper method to help retrieve the connection string name for the configured storage provider.
member.returns: The connection string name for the configured storage provider.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.DurableContextExtensions.WaitForCompletionOrCreateCheckStatusResponseAsync(Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.IDurableOrchestrationClient,System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an HTTP response which either contains a payload of management URLs for a non-completed instance or contains the payload containing the output of the completed orchestration.
member.remarks: If the orchestration instance completes within the default 10 second timeout, then the HTTP response payload will contain the output of the orchestration instance formatted as JSON. However, if the orchestration does not complete within this timeout, then the HTTP response will be identical to that of the API.
member.param: The client object.
The HTTP request that triggered the current function.
The unique ID of the instance to check.
member.returns: An HTTP response which may include a 202 and location header or a 200 with the durable function output in the response body.

However, if the orchestration does not complete within this timeout, then the HTTP response will be identical to that of the API.
member.param: The client object.
The HTTP request that triggered the current function.
The unique ID of the instance to check.
member.returns: An HTTP response which may include a 202 and location header or a 200 with the durable function output in the response body.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.IDeterministicExecutionContext
member.summary: Functionality available in all deterministic execution contexts, such as orchestrations or entity operations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.IDeterministicExecutionContext.CurrentUtcDateTime
member.summary: Gets the current date/time in a way that is safe for use in orchestrations and entity operations.
member.remarks: This date/time value is derived from the orchestration or entity history. It always returns the same value at specific points in the orchestrator function code, making it deterministic and safe for replay.
member.value: The orchestration or entity's current date/time in UTC.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.IDeterministicExecutionContext.IsReplaying
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the orchestration or operation is currently replaying itself.
member.remarks: This property is useful when there is logic that needs to run only when *not* replaying. For example, certain types of application logging may become too noisy when duplicated as part of replay. The application code could check to see whether the function is being replayed and then issue the log statements when this value is false.
member.value: true if the orchestration or operation is currently being replayed; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.IDeterministicExecutionContext.IsLocked(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.EntityId}@)
member.summary: Determines whether the current context is locked, and if so, what locks are currently owned.
member.param: The collection of owned locks.
member.remarks: Note that the collection of owned locks can be empty even if the context is locked. This happens if an orchestration calls a suborchestration without lending any locks.
member.returns: true if the context already holds some locks.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.IDeterministicExecutionContext.NewGuid
member.summary: Creates a new GUID that is safe for replay within an orchestration or operation.
member.remarks: The default implementation of this method creates a name-based UUID using the algorithm from RFC 4122 4.3. The name input used to generate this value is a combination of the orchestration instance ID and an internally managed sequence number.
member.returns: The new value.

member.remarks: If the orchestration instance completes within the specified timeout, then the HTTP response payload will contain the output of the orchestration instance formatted as JSON. However, if the orchestration does not complete within the specified timeout, then the HTTP response will be identical to that of the API.
member.param: The HTTP request that triggered the current function.
The unique ID of the instance to check.
Total allowed timeout for output from the durable function. The default value is 10 seconds.
The timeout between checks for output from the durable function. The default value is 1 second.
member.returns: An HTTP response which may include a 202 and location header or a 200 with the durable function output in the response body.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.WebJobs.IDurableOrchestrationContext.ContinueAsNew(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Restarts the orchestration by clearing its history.

remarks.para: Large orchestration histories can consume a lot of memory and cause delays in instance load times. This method can be used to periodically truncate the stored history of an orchestration instance.
Note that any unprocessed external events will be discarded when an orchestration instance restarts itself using this method.

member.param: The JSON-serializeable data to re-initialize the instance with.

If set to true, re-adds any unprocessed external events into the new execution history when the orchestration instance restarts. If false, any unprocessed external events will be discarded when the orchestration instance restarts.

member.remarks: The value is serialized to JSON and will be made available to the orchestration status query APIs. The serialized JSON value must not exceed 16 KB of UTF-16 encoded text.
member.param: The JSON-serializeable value to use as the orchestrator function's custom status.
